definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: Those boys have scribbled on the fence.
sentences.chinese: 那些男孩在柵欄上亂寫亂塗。

sentences.english: As to writing, we do not encourage them to scrawl too early .
sentences.chinese: 至於書法，我們不鼓勵他們過早地亂寫。

sentences.english: He too would roll up his sleeves and scribble for money.
sentences.chinese: 他也捲起袖子，爲錢亂寫一通。
在牆上亂寫亂畫是不對的。

sentences.english: I have tons of journals filled with nothing but scribble.
sentences.chinese: 我有很多日記本什麼都沒寫，除了亂寫亂畫。

sentences.english: Remember when your teacher told you to stop doodling in class?
sentences.chinese: 可曾記得你的老師叫你不要再在課堂上亂寫亂畫？

sentences.english: Stop vandalism. Don't scribble on walls.
sentences.chinese: 嚴禁破壞公物，禁止在牆上亂寫亂畫。

sentences.english: It took three applications of paint to cover the graffiti.
sentences.chinese: 刷了三道油漆才蓋住了亂塗亂寫的東西。

sentences.english: I know now, I should not write what.
sentences.chinese: 我知道此時此刻，我不該再亂寫什麼。

sentences.english: In this scribble scrawl, children start their initial graffiti experiment.
sentences.chinese: 在這種亂畫亂寫中，孩子開始了他們最初的塗鴉實驗。

definition: lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
faulty wording/mispronunciation due to a speech defect
(coll.) to regret/what a pity! (loanword from Japanese "zannen")
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
